VEvil.​AI.​AIAgentSettings
[Serializable]
public struct
VEvil.​AI.​AIAgentSettings

AIAgentSettings contain the settings that can be set into a AAIAgentEntity instance to configure it in runtime/editor.

Properties
BaseOffset
[field: SerializeField, Header("General Settings"), Tooltip("The relative vertical displacement of the owning GameObject.\nDefault value: 0")]
public float BaseOffset {
get;
set
}

The relative vertical displacement of the owning GameObject.

Speed
[field: SerializeField, Header("Movement Settings"), Tooltip("The maximum movement speed when following a target.\nDefault value: 3.5")]
public float Speed {
get;
set
}

The maximum movement speed when following a target.

AngularSpeed
[field: SerializeField, Tooltip("The maximum turning speed in degrees/second while following a path.\nDefault value: 120")]
public float AngularSpeed {
get;
set
}

The maximum turning speed in degrees/second while following a path.

Acceleration
[field: SerializeField, Tooltip("The maximum acceleration of the agent as it follow a path.\nIn units/sec^2.\nDefault value: 8")]
public float Acceleration {
get;
set
}

The maximum acceleration of the agent as it follow a path.

In units/sec^2.

[field: SerializeField, Tooltip("Stop withing this distance from the target position.\nDefault value: 0")]

Stop withing this distance from the target position.

}

Should the agent brake automatically to avoid overshooting the destination point ?

[field: SerializeField, Header("Obstacles Avoidance Settings"), Tooltip("The avoidance radius for the agent.\nDefault value: 0.5")]
public float Radius {
get;
set
}

The avoidance radius for the agent.

Height
[field: SerializeField, Tooltip("The height of the agent for purposes of passing under obstacles.\nDefault value: 2")]

get;
set
}

The height of the agent for purposes of passing under obstacles.

Quality
[field: SerializeField, Tooltip("Higher quality avoidance reduces more the chances of agents overlapping but it is slower to compute than lower quality avoidance.\nDefault value: HighQualityObstacleAvoidance")]
public ObstacleAvoidanceType Quality {
get;
set
}

Higher quality avoidance reduces more the chances of agents overlapping but it is slower to compute than lower quality avoidance.
